CatDescriptText: Sylvanus Banks, taxicab driver, 1410 Beltzhoover Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think Negro business places should have the right to operate in Lower Hill after that section has been beautified?"  Answer reads: "Yes, indeed. Colored businesses and colored homes were located in the area before and were torn down in order to make way for the redevelopment of the area.  Therefore they should have preference.  Negro business should be allowed to locate there."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Sylvanus Banks wearing moustache, dark jacket with striped collar, dark necktie, and People's Cab hat, seated in car, sign above inscribed "...haberdashers"
